However I was also fairly confident that I would give him a hell of a time trying to beat me in the endgame, where I felt more confident of my abilities than in French-style complications that he is probably very familiar with. So this is a decision based mainly on off-the-board considerations.

One is that he wants to play ...Bd6 with tempo since I will not be able to reply Qh5. There is also an idea that, strangely, he did not try to implement in the game. In rough form it is to play ...Bxf2, Bc5, Bxf8, Bg7, etc. In any case, it seems to me that this is one of the more relavent things he can do with his time, compared to 13...a6, for example.
